Recipes/Breads/Banana-Bread.title: Banana Bread
Recipes/Breads/Banana-Bread.content:
Ingredients:
1 cup butter
3/4 cup sugar
3 large overripe bananas (or 4 medium), mashed
2 eggs
2 cups flour
1 tsp baking soda
Instructions:
Combine butter (room temp/melted) and sugar. Add bananas and eggs. Mix well. Add flour and soda.
Bake at 325 for 1 hour and 15 min in a greased loaf pan (or 65 minutes if using a wider, non-loaf pan)

Recipes/Breads/Pumpkin-Bread.title: Pumpkin Bread
Recipes/Breads/Pumpkin-Bread.content:
Ingredients:
Combine:
1 3/4 cups white sugar
3/4 cups brown sugar (try experimenting with a heavier brown sugar ratio)
1 cup butter [!tip] Original recipe calls for corn oil but I don’t regularly carry that
4 beaten eggs
1 can pumpkin
3 1/2 cups flour
1 tsp baking powder
2 tsp baking soda
2 tsp salt
1 tsp cloves [!tip] I like cloves
1 tsp cinnamon
1 tsp nutmeg
2/3 cup water
Instructions:
Combine sugar, butter, eggs. Add and blend pumpkin.
Sift together and add flour, baking powder, soda, salt, cloves, cinnamon, and nutmeg. Then add water
Bake in 2 greased and floured loaf pans for 1 hour at 350
[!tip] Flouring isn’t strictly necessary (I haven’t tried it) but may help with sticking

Recipes/Breads/White-Bread.title: White Bread
Recipes/Breads/White-Bread.content:
Taken from King Arthur’s flour website. Use 1.5 lb setting with medium crust on white bread.
1 cup lukewarm water
1/3 cup lukewarm milk
3 tbsp butter
3 tbsp sugar
3 3/4 cup all purpose flour
1.5 tsp salt
1.5 tsp yeast
Mix all together in bread machine. Takes ~3 hours

Recipes/Casseroles/Chicken-and-Broccoli-.title: Chicken and Broccoli Casserole
Recipes/Casseroles/Chicken-and-Broccoli-.content:
4 boneless chicken breasts (cooked and diced)
2 cans cream of chicken soup
1 cup mayo
1 cup sour cream
1 bag frozen broccoli (cook and drain)
1 box cheezits (crushed)
Preheat oven at 350.
Layer chicken in 9x13 pan with broccoli on top. Mix soup, mayo, and sour cream; spread atop broccoli. Spread crushed cheezits on top.
Bake for 45 minutes.

Recipes/Desserts/Basque-Cheesecake.title: Basque Cheesecake
Recipes/Desserts/Basque-Cheesecake.content:
1 3/4 cups sugar (1 cup granulated and 3/4 cup brown)
2 1/4 lbs (36 oz) cream cheese at room temperature
1/4 tsp salt
5 eggs
2 cups heavy cream
1/4 cup all purpose flour
1 tbsp vanilla
Preheat oven at 400 degrees.
Line 10in springform pan with parchment paper along bottom and sides (helps to crumple up first).
In a large bowl, cream sugar and cream cheese. Add salt and mix until smooth. Add eggs one at a time and beat until fully incorporated. Beat in the cream and vanilla on low, and then gradually sift in the flour.
Pour batter into prepared pan. Bake until browned/almost burnt on top, 50-60 minutes. Center will still be jiggly. Remove cake from oven and cool completely on rack (this takes several hours, and some recommend refrigerating overnight).
Graham cracker crust:
1 cup crushed (to dust) graham crackers (put in ziplock and smoosh with hands/rolling pin)
4.5 tbsp butter
2 tbsp brown sugar
Cook in oven for 5 min at 350. Let cool before pouring batter into it.
Alec notes:
Lots of room for fun additions here. Could add fruit (peppered strawberries?), or cook for less time (30 min then let sit in fridge overnight).

On my first attempt, I think I cooked it at 350 instead of 400. Took about 70 min. I then let it sit on the counter for an hour, then in the fridge for an hour, then in the freezer for an hour. It was fairly runny in the middle. Still tasty, but better to make a day in advance.

Recipes/Desserts/Bread-Pudding.title: Bread Pudding
Recipes/Desserts/Bread-Pudding.content:
6 slices of bread, broken into small pieces and kinda stale
5 cups milk
1 tsp vanilla
1 cup heavy cream
5 eggs, beaten
1/2 cup brown sugar
1/2 cup sugar
Pinch of salt
About 2 tbsp butter, cut into 5-6 small pieces
Sprinkle of nutmeg and cinnamon
Preheat oven at 425.
Combine all ingredients except butter, nutmeg, and cinnamon. Pour into greased pan. Put pieces butter on top (about 1/4 tbsp each). Sprinkle with nutmeg and cinnamon. Bake for 50 min.

Recipes/Desserts/Brittany's-Chocolate-Ch.title: Brittany's Chocolate Chip Cookies
Recipes/Desserts/Brittany's-Chocolate-Ch.content:
2 1/3 cups all purpose flour
1 cup brown sugar
1/2 cup sugar
1 egg, beaten
1 egg yolk
1 tsp baking soda
1 tbsp corn starch
1 tsp salt
1 tbsp vanilla
3/4 cup unsalted butter (room temp/melted)
1 cup chocolate chips
Preheat oven at 325.
Cream sugars and butter in one bowl, then add vanilla and eggs. Mix dry ingredients in another. Add dry mix to larger bowl along with chocolate chips.
Spray baking sheet with oil and bake for 12 minutes.

Recipes/Desserts/Caramel-Pie.title: Caramel Pie
Recipes/Desserts/Caramel-Pie.content:
1 graham cracker crust (8in)
2 cans (28 oz) Sweetened Condensed Milk
Cool Whip (optional to top; about 1/2 tub)
Remove paper from cans. Place cans in a pot large enough to submerge them completely in water. Fill with water to cover cans. Bring to a low boil. Cover and continue low boil for 3 hours. Add water as needed to keep cans submerged. Carefully remove cans and place on a towel. Cool for 10 minutes. Open cans carefully. Pour caramel into pie crust. Freeze for at least 3 hours. Remove from freezer and spread Cool Whip on top. Return to freezer until ready to serve.​​​​​​​​​​​​​​​​

Recipes/Desserts/Chocolate-Cake.title: Chocolate Cake
Recipes/Desserts/Chocolate-Cake.content:
1 stick butter
1 cup water
1/4 cup cocoa
1/2 cup vegetable oil
1/2 tsp salt
1 tsp baking soda
2 eggs
1 tsp vanilla
1/2 cup buttermilk
2 cups all purpose flour
2 cups sugar
Preheat oven at 375.
Mix butter, water, cocoa, and oil together and bring to a boil. Sift together flour, sugar, salt, and baking soda. Add hot chocolate mixture to dry ingredients. Add eggs, vanilla, and buttermilk. Mix well.
Pour into 9x13 pan and bake for 30 min.
Icing:
1 stick butter
1/4 cup cocoa
1/2 cup buttermilk
Powdered sugar*
1 tsp vanilla
Bring butter, cocoa, and buttermilk to a boil. Beat in powdered sugar and vanilla. Pour over cake while hot.
*Mom buys a bag of powdered sugar and keeps adding it to the icing until it has the consistency that she wants. Usually about 3/4 a bag. You want it to be pourable.

Recipes/Desserts/Grammy's-Red-Velvet-Cak.title: Grammy's Red Velvet Cake
Recipes/Desserts/Grammy's-Red-Velvet-Cak.content:
1/2 cup vegetable shortening
1.5 cups sugar
2 eggs (room temp)
1 tsp salt
2 tsp cocoa
1 cup buttermilk (room temp)
2 oz food coloring (1 oz bottle + 1 oz water)
2.5 cups flour
1 tsp vanilla
1 tsp soda in 1 tbsp vinegar
Preheat oven at 350.
Cream shortening and sugar. Add eggs, 1 at a time, and beat until smooth and well-blended. Sift flour, salt, and cocoa together. Add alternating with buttermilk, beating well after each addition. Add vanilla and food coloring. Mix and stir in the last vinegar and soda. DO NOT BEAT AFTER THIS.
Bake for 30 minutes
Brittany notes:

Cake took 45 min instead of 30.

Maybe only fill pan up halfway.


Bowl 1- cream shortening and sugar then add eggs
Bowl 2- Flour, salt, cocoa
Add a little bit of Bowl 2 to Bowl 1, then add a little bit of buttermilk, and so on until everything is in Bowl 1.
Add vanilla, food coloring, vinegar, and baking soda to Bowl 1.

Icing:
1 cup milk
1/4 cup flour
1 1/4 cup sugar
3/4 cup vegetable shortening
1 tsp vanilla
Combine milk and flour. Cook until thick like white sauce., stirring constantly. Set aside to cool completely (takes several hours! Put in fridge).
Cream sugar and shortening until light and fluffy. Add vanilla and cooled cream sauce—beat until frosting becomes stiff.
Brittany notes:

Whisk flour and 1 cup sugar on medium heat for 2 minutes
Add milk and turn to medium high, keep whisking
When simmering and creamy, whisk for 2 minutes then stop.
Put bowl in fridge
When cool, mix shortening with mix gradually. Add 1/4 cup sugar, vanilla, and pinch salt.

Recipes/Desserts/No-Bake-Oat-Cookies.title: No Bake Oat Cookies
Recipes/Desserts/No-Bake-Oat-Cookies.content:
4 cups sugar
1 cup milk
1 stick butter
4 cups oats
2/3 cup cocoa
1 cup peanut butter
1 tsp vanilla
Boil sugar, milk, butter, and cocoa for 4 minutes. Add remaining ingredients, stir, then drop onto wax paper. Ready to serve once cooled.

Recipes/Desserts/Pecan-Pie.title: Pecan Pie
Recipes/Desserts/Pecan-Pie.content:
1 cup sugar
1/4 cup butter (room temp/melted)
1 cup white corn syrup (Karo)
1/4 tsp salt
3 eggs
1 cup pecans
Preheat oven at 350.
Cream sugar and butter. Add syrup and salt. Beat eggs in, 1 at a time. Pour into pie shell. Place pecans on top. Bake for 1 hour and 15 minutes.

Recipes/Desserts/Pumpkin-Pie.title: Pumpkin Pie
Recipes/Desserts/Pumpkin-Pie.content:
2 eggs
15 oz can pumpkin
3/4 cup sugar
1/2 tsp salt
1 tsp cinnamon
1/2 tsp ginger
1/4 tsp cloves
1 can evaporated milk
Preheat oven at 425.
Combine ingredients, then pour into pie shell. Bake for 15 minutes.
Then reduce heat to 350 for 45 minutes (35 minutes at 2950 Franklin Pike)

Recipes/Meat-and-Seafoods/Grammy's-Meatl.title: Grammy's Meatloaf
Recipes/Meat-and-Seafoods/Grammy's-Meatl.content:
1.5 lbs ground beef
1 onion, chopped
2 eggs, beaten
1 cup Italian breadcrumbs
1.5 tsp salt
1/4 tsp pepper
1/4 can tomato paste (small can)
1/4 can tomato sauce (15 oz can)
Preheat oven at 350.
Combine all to form loaf.
Sauce:
3/4 can tomato sauce
5 tbsp brown sugar
2 tsp Worcestshire sauce
3 tbsp white vinegar
2 tbsp mustard
Mix together and pour over meatloaf.
Bake for 1.5 hours.
(Mom’s Italian variation is basically the same, but she uses spaghetti sauce instead of the sauce and adds 1 cup shredded parmesan cheese to the loaf)

Recipes/Meat-and-Seafoods/Hamburger-Grav.title: Hamburger Gravy
Recipes/Meat-and-Seafoods/Hamburger-Grav.content:
1 lb ground beef
1/2 stick butter
3 tbsp flour
1 can evaporated milk (and one can water and two cans milk)
1 tbsp salt
1 tsp pepper
2 tsp beef bouillon (more to taste)
Cook ground beef and drain. Push to side of pan. In the same pan, melt butter and add flour to make a paste. Mix paste into ground beef. Add remaining ingredients and cook until thick.

Recipes/Meat-and-Seafoods/Hamburger-and-.title: Hamburger and Potatoes
Recipes/Meat-and-Seafoods/Hamburger-and-.content:
1 lb ground beef
6 potatoes, sliced
1/2 stick butter
1 packet Lipton Beefy Onion Soup mix
~4 cups water
Salt and pepper to taste
Cook ground beef and drain. Add sliced potatoes. Sprinkle soup mix on top of potatoes. Cover with water (may need more or less water to do so). Put butter on top. Cook until potatoes start to soften (but not mushy).

Recipes/Meat-and-Seafoods/Salmon-Patties.title: Salmon Patties
Recipes/Meat-and-Seafoods/Salmon-Patties.content:
2 cans salmon, drained and deboned
1/2 cup cornmeal
1/4 cup breadcrumbs (Italian preferred)
3 eggs, mixed
1/4 cup mayo
1/4 tsp garlic and onion powder
Mix everything together and form into patties. (If too dry, add mayo. If too wet, cornmeal). Fry in oil/butter for 3-5 minutes on each side until golden brown.
Serve with a mayo-sriracha sauce. get 1-2 cups mayo and add sriracha sauce (about 3 tbsp) until medium pink.

Recipes/Meat-and-Seafoods/Shredded-Pork-.title: Shredded Pork Butt
Recipes/Meat-and-Seafoods/Shredded-Pork-.content:
4-6 lbs pork butt (boneless), trim off fat
1 diced onion
5 cloves garlic, minced
1/4 cup EVOO
3 tbsp packed brown sugar
1 tbsp salt and paprika
1 tsp pepper, onion and garlic powder, and cumin
2 oz apple cider vinegar (or a shot of brown liquor of your choice)
1 can Dr. Pepper (or your soda of choice)
1 can beer (of your choice)
(Could also add a can of pineapple juice alongside the other liquids)
Preheat oven at 300 and warm up dutch oven med-high.
Cut pork into several large pieces. Combine brown sugar, spices, and rub onto pork. Sear each side of the pork pieces (3-4 min each side). Then cook onion and garlic until fragrant.
Add beer, Dr. Pepper, and a shot of apple cider vinegar. Cover with lid and place in oven. Cook for 3 hours. Remove lid and cook for 1.5 hours more. Check if done by trying to shred with forks…if it comes apart easily, it’s done!

Recipes/Meat-and-Seafoods/Steelhead-Trou.title: Steelhead Trout
Recipes/Meat-and-Seafoods/Steelhead-Trou.content:
Big fillet steelhead trout
3 tbsp melted butter or oil
Lemon juice
Spices (herbes de Provence style or Cajun/old bay style)
3-4 garlic cloves, minced
1/2 tsp dried dill weed
Salt and pepper to taste
Lemon slices for topping
Preheat oven to 375°F. Stir oil into lemon juice, garlic, spices, salt and pepper. Place large piece of foil on baking sheet and a bit of oil on bottom. Add trout to foil, dry off with paper towel, and squeeze lemon juice over top. Drizzle oil spice mixture over fish. Lay lemon slices on top.
Cover trout tightly with foil (leave some room inside but no holes). Bake for 20 minutes. Turn oven to broil at 400°F, uncover fish, and bake additional 3-4 minutes until opaque and flaky.​​​​​​​​​​​​​​​​

Recipes/Sauces/Alfredo.title: Alfredo
Recipes/Sauces/Alfredo.content:
5 cloves garlic
2 cups heavy cream
5 tbsp butter
4 oz cream cheese
3/4 cup Parmesan
1 tsp salt
1/2 tsp pepper
1/2 tsp herbs de Provence
Melt butter over medium-low heat.
•	Add minced garlic and sauté for 30–45 seconds, until fragrant (don’t brown it).
•	Pour in the heavy cream and bring to a gentle simmer for 2–3 minutes.
•	Stir in Parmesan and cream cheese a handful at a time, whisking until melted and smooth.
•	Season with salt, black pepper, and a pinch of nutmeg or red pepper if using.

Recipes/Sauces/Marinara-Sauce.title: Marinara Sauce
Recipes/Sauces/Marinara-Sauce.content:
28 oz whole peeled San Marzano tomatoes (canned)
1/4 cup EVOO
7 cloves garlic, minced
Red pepper flakes to taste
1 tsp salt
1/4 tsp oregano
Crush tomatoes with hands in large bowl. Pour 1 cup water into can to get rest of juices and set aside. Heat oil in saucepan, sizzle garlic, add tomatoes and water.
Add red pepper flakes, salt, and oregano. Stir and simmer for 15 min (until sauce is thickened and oil on surface is deep orange).
(If you want a thicker sauce, add a can of tomato sauce or paste in addition to the whole peeled tomatoes).

Recipes/Sauces/Vodka-Sauce.title: Vodka Sauce
Recipes/Sauces/Vodka-Sauce.content:
1/4 cup EVOO
2.5 cups Spanish onion
3 cloves minced garlic
1/2 tsp red pepper flakes
1.5 tsp oregano
1 cup vodka
2 tsp salt (and then another 1 tsp)
1/2 tsp pepper (and then another 1/2 tsp)
7 cups (56 oz) whole peeled plum tomatoes
2 tbsp chopped fresh oregano
1 cup heavy cream
1/2 cup grated parmesan
Preheat oven to 375. Heat oil in dutch oven. Add onions and garlic and cook for 5 minutes (until onions are translucent). Add red pepper flakes, oregano, and cook for 1 more minute.
Add vodka and simmer for 5-7 min. Crush tomatoes into pan. Add 2 tsp salt and 1/2 tsp pepper. Cover dutch oven and put into oven. Bake for 1.5 hours.
Cook pasta and set aside.
Pour tomato mixture into blender (2 cups at a time, caution hot) and puree until smooth. Put back into dutch oven. Add fresh oregano, cream, 1 tsp salt, 1/2 tsp pepper, and simmer partially covered for 10 minutes. Add pasta and cook for 2 more minutes. Stir in parmesan and serve hot, sprinkled with more parmesan and oregano.

Recipes/Soups/Chili.title: Chili
Recipes/Soups/Chili.content:
2 lbs ground beef/turkey
2 tbsp EVOO
1 onion, diced
3 cups beef stock
5 cloves garlic, minced
1 can kidney beans
2 cans pinto beans
1 can black beans
2 packs chili spice mix
1 can rotel
1 large can diced tomatoes
(Advanced edition: brown sugar, curry powder, and sweet peppers)
Heat up oil in dutch oven, then add onions/garlic and cook until fragrant. (If you want to get tricky, add 2-3 tbsp brown sugar here with some sweet peppers. Then add ~1/4 tsp curry powder with spices alongside chili mix.) Add tomato, rotel, and beans (drained and rinsed).
Add beef stock and heat on medium high. Cook meat (seasoned generously with seasoning salt) until just almost fully cooked, then add to pot with oils. Add chili mix, bring to boil and stirring regularly, and then simmer for 10 minutes.
Serve with sour cream and shredded cheese and peanut butter sandwiches.

Recipes/Soups/Lentil-Soup.title: Lentil Soup
Recipes/Soups/Lentil-Soup.content:
1 cup lentils
1/4 cup EVOO
1 cup chopped carrots
1 cup chopped celery
1 cup chopped onions
28 oz diced tomatoes
64 oz (two cartons) chicken stock
2 cups water
6 cloves garlic, minced
1/2 tsp cumin, coriander, paprika, ground mustard, chili powder, and curry powder
1 tsp salt and pepper and herbs de provence
1 tbsp lemon juice
Heat oil over medium in dutch oven. Add in carrots and celery and cook for 10 min. Add garlic and onions and cook for 2 more minutes. Add in tomatoes and spices (incl. salt and pepper). Cook another 2 minutes.
Add lentils, water, and chicken stock. Raise heat to medium-high until boiling. Then put lid on and simmer for 25-30 min. Stir regularly until lentils are soft and cooked.
Once done, puree two cups of soup and add back in. Add 1 tbsp lemon juice and salt/pepper to taste.
(Can add greens at end and cook for 5 more minutes).
(If you want spicy, add 1/4 tsp cayenne pepper and 1/2 red pepper flakes).

Recipes/Soups/White-Chicken-Chili.title: White Chicken Chili
Recipes/Soups/White-Chicken-Chili.content:
2 chicken breasts, cooked and shredded
1 tbsp olive oil
1 onion, diced
5 cloves of garlic, minced
1 can Rotel
32 oz chicken broth
1.5 tsp cumin
0.5 tsp coriander
0.5 tsp paprika
0.5 tsp oregano
0.25 tsp cayenne pepper
~30 oz cannelli beans
1 small can corn
8 oz neufchatel cheese (or cream cheese)
A sprinkle of lime juice
Salt and pepper to taste
Heat oil in dutch oven over medium high heat. Saute onion for 4 min then add garlic and saute for another minute. Add chicken broth, Rotel, spices, and bring to a boil. Then simmer for 10 minutes.
Drain and rinse beans. Take 1 cup beans with 1/4 cup broth from soup and puree.
Add Neufchatel cheese (break up), corn, beans, and stir well. Simmer for 10 min longer. Stir in chicken and lime juice. Simmer for another 5 min.
Serve with sour cream, shredded cheese, and avocado.

Recipes/Veggies/Acorn-Squash.title: Acorn Squash
Recipes/Veggies/Acorn-Squash.content:
Acorn squashes, cut in half and pulp/seeds removed
2 tbsp brown sugar and 1 tbsp butter per squash half
Preheat oven at 400.
Put acorn squash halves (2-3) on an oven-safe dinner plate, upside down, after filling bottom of plate with water. Put in microwave for 8 minutes.
Turn squash halves back over, remove water from plate, and add brown sugar/butter to each half. Put in oven and cook for 25 minutes.

Recipes/Veggies/Collard-Greens.title: Collard Greens
Recipes/Veggies/Collard-Greens.content:
1 bag collard greens
1 cup chicken broth (or more of you want; beef is not great as a replacement)
1 tbsp EVOO or butter
2 tsp hot smoked paprika (or regular is fine)
1 tsp cayenne pepper
1 tsp salt and 1/2 tsp pepper
Mix oil and spices into a bowl and pour over greens in Instant Pot bowl. Cook for 4 minutes on high. Once done, release steam, drain, and serve.

Recipes/Veggies/Roasted-Eggplant.title: Roasted Eggplant
Recipes/Veggies/Roasted-Eggplant.content:
2 medium eggplants
EVOO
Sprinkles of salt, pepper, and thyme
Preheat oven to 450. Cut eggplants into 1 inch cubes. Line baking sheet with parchment paper. Toss eggplant in bowl with EVOO and spices. Put onto baking sheet in one layer and cook for 20 minutes. Take out, flip, and cook for another 10 min. Sprinkle thyme and serve.

Recipes/Veggies/Stuffed-Portobello-Mushr.title: Stuffed Portobello Mushrooms
Recipes/Veggies/Stuffed-Portobello-Mushr.content:
2 portobello caps
1 tbsp butter, cut in half
1 tsp thyme
2 tbsp EVOO
1 tbsp parmesan, grated
3 tbsp shredded cheese (mozzarella is best, but mexican is good too…feta also adds a nice zing)
Salt and pepper to taste
Preheat oven to 400. Wipe mushrooms clean and remove stems.
Sprinkle oil on a baking sheet with parchment paper. Put shrooms on it, face up.
Mix salt, pepper, thyme, and EVOO in a bowl. Drizzle over shrooms.
Put one butter on each shroom and bake for 15 min.
Mix parmesan and shredded cheese and put into tops of shrooms. Bake for another 5 min.

Recipes/Veggies/Sweet-Potato-Casserole.title: Sweet Potato Casserole
Recipes/Veggies/Sweet-Potato-Casserole.content:
5 large sweet potatoes
1/2 stick of butter
1/2 cup brown sugar (to taste)
2 eggs
Pinch of salt
Preheat oven at 350.
Peel and boil sweet potatoes until soft. Let cool a little, then mash potatoes. Add butter, brown sugar, and eggs. Blend thoroughly. Pour into a casserole dish.
Bake for about 25 minutes.
Then, right before serving, put marshmallows on top and cook at 425°F (or broil) until marshmallows are browned.

Recipes/Veggies/Yams.title: Yams
Recipes/Veggies/Yams.content:
1 large can of yams
2 tbsp butter
1/2 cup brown sugar
1/2 cup granulated sugar
Cinnamon to taste
Preheat oven at 400.
Drain yam juice into saucepan and bring to a boil with sugars, cinnamon, and butter. Place yams into large oven-safe bowl, pour mixture over yams, and cook for 30 min.

index.title: Home Page
index.content:
This is my digital garden. In this space, I pursue more creative endeavors, sharing my thoughts on various works (e.g., video games, albums) and other fun things like recipes and tutorials regarding my wide assortment of hobbies.
I hope you enjoy!
